thread.title: Wisconsin severe weather: flooding, thunderstorms, outages
thread.title_full: Wisconsin severe weather: flooding, thunderstorms, outages

author: @fox6now
title: Wisconsin severe weather: flooding, thunderstorms, outages
text:
Wisconsin severe weather: flooding, thunderstorms, outages By FOX6 News Digital Team Updated August 1, 2024 10:07pm CDT Severe Weather FOX6 News Milwaukee Share
Copy Link Email Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Reddit Southeast Wisconsin sees flooding from storms Severe weather hit southeast Wisconsin on Thursday evening, Aug. 1, causing flooding and power outages.
MILWAUKEE - Severe weather hit southeast Wisconsin on Thursday evening, Aug. 1, causing flooding and power outages.
As of 10:50 p.m., there were more than 14,300 people without power .
The National Weather Service also issued severe thunderstorm warnings for southeastern Wisconsin counties on Thursday, Aug. 1. Warnings were in effect for Waukesha and Jefferson counties until 8:15 p.m.
The weather also caused the first day of the Wisconsin State Fair to cancel events.

School and business closings When the weather gets a little dicey, schools and businesses may shut down. Monitor the latest list of closings, cancellations, and delays reported in southeast Wisconsin.
